title: Post WW2 nationalism and ethnic conflict 1

content.description: The following question refers to the topic of nationalism and ethnic conflict in the postwar period.
content.question: Which of the following best explains why the end of communist repression associated with the fall of the Soviet Union had the effect of encouraging a revival of nationalist tensions in Eastern Europe?

choices.label: Economic growth and living standards suffered an irreversible collapse in Eastern Europe after the withdrawal of Soviet economic support.
The Soviet conquest of Eastern Europe in the Second World War had resulted in the virtual expulsion of ethnic German populations from many regions they had previously inhabited.
The fall of communist governments in the Soviet satellite countries of Eastern Europe largely occurred without violence.
Soviet ideology had encouraged international cooperation among communist countries and had attempted to suppress ethnic and other cultural differences.

content.answer: Soviet ideology had encouraged international cooperation among communist countries and had attempted to suppress ethnic and other cultural differences.
